document.discussion_title: Navios Maritime Partners L.P. (NMM) Downgraded by Zacks Investment Research to Sell
document.topic_text: Tweet Zacks Investment Research cut shares of Navios Maritime Partners L.P. (NYSE:NMM) from a hold rating to a sell rating in a research note issued to investors on Tuesday. According to Zacks, “Navios Maritime Partners L.P. is an international owner and operator of dry cargo vessels. It engages in the seaborne transportation services of drybulk commodities including iron ore, coal, grains, fertilizers and chartering of its vessels under medium to long-term charters. Navios Maritime Partners L.P. is headquartered in Piraeus, Greece. “ Separately, Jefferies Group restated a buy rating on shares of Navios Maritime Partners L.P. in a research report on Monday, August 1st. Two equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, four have issued a hold rating and two have issued a buy rating to the company. The company has a consensus rating of Hold and a consensus price target of $5.05. Shares of Navios Maritime Partners L.P. ( NYSE:NMM ) opened at 1.59 on Tuesday. The firm has a market capitalization of $134.79 million and a price-to-earnings ratio of 45.43. The firm’s 50-day moving average is $1.47 and its 200-day moving average is $1.39. Navios Maritime Partners L.P. has a 12-month low of $0.79 and a 12-month high of $9.07. Navios Maritime Partners L.P. (NYSE:NMM) last announced its earnings results on Thursday, August 11th. The company reported ($0.20) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing analysts’ consensus estimates of $0.05 by $0.25. The business had revenue of $44.90 million for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $50.13 million. The company’s revenue was down 20.5% compared to the same quarter last year. During the same period in the prior year, the firm posted $0.13 EPS. Equities research analysts forecast that Navios Maritime Partners L.P. will post $0.05 EPS for the current fiscal year. Other institutional investors have recently bought and sold shares of the company. Sanders Morris Harris Inc. raised its position in Navios Maritime Partners L.P. by 1.5% in the second quarter. Sanders Morris Harris Inc. now owns 133,650 shares of the company’s stock worth $172,000 after buying an additional 2,000 shares in the last quarter. Renaissance Technologies LLC increased its stake in Navios Maritime Partners L.P. by 30.5% in the first quarter. Renaissance Technologies LLC now owns 503,800 shares of the company’s stock worth $625,000 after buying an additional 117,800 shares during the last quarter. Two Sigma Investments LLC increased its stake in Navios Maritime Partners L.P. by 6,217.3% in the fourth quarter. Two Sigma Investments LLC now owns 937,048 shares of the company’s stock worth $2,830,000 after buying an additional 922,215 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Two Sigma Advisers LLC increased its stake in Navios Maritime Partners L.P. by 310.6% in the fourth quarter. Two Sigma Advisers LLC now owns 462,368 shares of the company’s stock worth $1,396,000 after buying an additional 349,753 shares during the last quarter. Navios Maritime Partners L.P. (Navios Partners) is an international owner and operator of dry bulk and container vessels formed by Navios Holdings, which is a vertically integrated seaborne shipping company. The Company is engaged in the seaborne transportation services of a range of dry cargo commodities, including iron ore, coal, grain, fertilizer and also containers, chartering its vessels under medium to long-term charters. Get a free copy of the Zacks research report on Navios Maritime Partners L.P. (NMM) For more information about research offerings from Zacks Investment Research, visit Zacks.com Navios Maritime Partners L.P. Navios Maritime Partners L.P.
